definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to repent and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf

sentences.english: What is God's promise to the penitent sinner?
sentences.chinese: 神對悔過的罪人的應許是什麼？

sentences.english: A penitent cell would have been your home long ago.
sentences.chinese: 一間悔過房早就應該成爲你的住所了。

sentences.english: After his release from prison, John vowed to live down his crimes.
sentences.chinese: 約翰出獄後立誓要悔過自新，使人們原諒他的罪行。

sentences.english: Repentance before a fresh start" is an important scholarly proposition made by LI Er quin his early period."
sentences.chinese: “悔過自新”是李二曲早期提出的重要學術主張。

sentences.english: Xinhua described the gift as 'an act of remorse' from Li for associating China's ubiquitous animal with his criminal activity.
sentences.chinese: 新華社稱該捐贈是李俊對自己將犯罪行爲的悔過自新。

sentences.english: Only the truly repentant at any right at all expect a second chance.
sentences.chinese: 只有真心悔過，纔有權利獲得第二次機會。

sentences.english: His wife will keep him straight when he is released from prison.
sentences.chinese: 他出獄後，他的妻子將幫助他悔過自新。

sentences.english: You have deeply and sorely repented.
sentences.chinese: 你已經深刻而痛徹地悔過了。

sentences.english: Those who were penitent obtained absolution .
What I he left? In writing this confession.
sentences.chinese: 我還能剩什麼？在書寫這悔過書。

sentences.english: Do not we become penitent and remorseful and crave for reunion?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們不能悔過自新，渴望重建聯盟嗎？

sentences.english: He opened his home to gang members who were trying to go straight and he went to college to get an education.
sentences.chinese: 他幫助願意悔過自新的幫派成員，並上了大學。

sentences.english: Considering the signs he showed of genuine repentance, we shall deal leniently with him.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到他真誠悔過的表現，我們將給予他寬大的處理。

sentences.english: Have I rehabilitated myself, you ask?
sentences.chinese: 你問我有沒有悔過自新？

definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
